page.title: 07PARISH HALL E.WORLINGTON
page.content: The parish hall is very old it is made of cob with a thatched roof.It used to be a tithe barn and it is between the church and the old rectory.People can hire it from the post office for meetings,parties and dances.The cost is Â£2 an hour for parishioners and Â£3 an hour for outsiders.The kitchen is Â£2 an hour,tables Â£1 and chairs 10p.The school uses it for country dancing and entertainments.It is also used for parish council meetings, church council meetings , W.I. and table tennis.It is run by the parish hall committee.Mrs.Stone is chairwoman,Lady Stevens is vice chairwoman,Mr. Jenkins is secretary and Mr. Wall is treasurer. Different groups in the community are represented on the committee which meets 3 times a year.
